content.text: A function f is called injective if f(x) = f(y) for all x, y implies x â‰  y.

content.proposition: For any integer n, if n^2 is odd, then n is odd.
content.proof:
We prove the contrapositive: if \( n \) is even, then \( n^2 \) is even. Suppose \( n \) is even, so \( n = 2k \) for some integer \( k \). Then
\[
n^2 = (2k)^2 = 4k^2 = 2(2k^2),
\]
which is even. Therefore, if \( n^2 \) is even, \( n \) must be even, so the original statement is true.

content.proposition: For any integer n, if n^2 is odd, then n is odd.
